Art. 4.110. 
Obligation to continue operations
The transferee, or at least one of them if there is more than one transferee, must personally occupy and manage the immovable property that is the subject of the acquisition within three months and for a period of five years from the date on which the deed of acquisition is signed, failing which he or she must pay each of the former owners or their heirs compensation set at a flat rate of twenty per cent of the total sum received by them as the price of the acquisition.
The transferee may be relieved of the obligation to occupy and manage the property personally, for serious reasons, either at the time of the takeover or subsequently by the Family Court of the judicial district in which the property with the highest cadastral income is located.
In the latter case, the procedure to be followed is identical to that set out in Article 4.109.
